sub_title: 'Great at planning, finishing and following up', that is in a nutshell who I am.  If the employees can focus on their core tasks, I have done my job well.
summary:
More than 35 years international HR experience in various different roles, excel in planning, implementing and following up.
As Content Management, delivered and implemented within 8 months refreshed HR content, used by more than 80.000 employees in 50 countries. 
As Team Lead Expatriate Transfer Services and Talent Operations Advisor for cost saving, successfully migrated operational responsibilities to HR service centres in Krakow, Poland and Manila, Philippines.

education.field_of_study: English, Dutch, German, French, History, Geography

projects.title: Onboarding: pre-employment and hiring portal
projects.description: Created business requirements for the onboarding portal, which will be used by new joiners, to guide them through the pre-employment and hiring process. Working together with Shell's preferred vendor on building the portal which should be able to, for example, generate contracts on global and local levels.

contributors.headline: 'Great at planning, finishing and following up', that is in a nutshell who I am.  If the employees can focus on their core tasks, I have done my job well.

profile_positions.description:
Working as Personal Assistant for Director of vBoxx. 
Responsibilities:
- Creating employment contracts for employees and interns
- Holding onboarding session with new colleagues;
- Updating personnel system for new personnel and flex workers
- Organising programme for annual company weekend
- Updating several finance systems with regards to invoice details
- Several office manager tasks
profile_positions.title: Persoonlijke assistent

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
- Successful global implementation of HR content of the new HR portal (Salesforce) for approximately 80.000 employees/line managers in collaboration with colleagues in 50 different countries and Salesforce developers
- Leading the HR content editor team (4 staff)
- Applying the Scrum & Agile project methodology as Scrum Master
- Implementation of cost savings by efficient content management by analysing user data
- Quality maintenance of HR content by analysing user data and implementing continuous improvements.
- Advising content owner community (90 content owners world-wide) how to effectively write for the web.
profile_positions.title: Content Management Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
- Coaching & capability building of Talent Services Team in Manila, Philippines
- Succesful migration of Talent processes to HR service centre in Manila
- Efficiently and effectively running of RDS global talent processes
- Knowledge Management
- Global Onboarding process
- Talent Reviews
- Global Graduate Programme network.
profile_positions.title: Talent Operations & Knowledge Management Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
- Optimalisation of the global HR portal by monthly analysis of user data
- Maintenance of quality of data of the HR personnel system and the correct application of the European Data Privacy Law
- Leading the project to improve the usability of the HR portal’s home page, in collaboration with content owners, IT project lead and external software company.
- Writing of test scripts
- Coordination of user acceptance testing of web applications and web forms.

Projects, next to normal responsibilities:
- Coordination and successful implementation of the annual salary increase cycle for employees in Argentina, Brazil, Canada, Chile and Venezuela.
- Acting as IT Business Analyst, the linking pin between various businesses, IR and the external software designer, for the replacement of the expatriate transfer system.
profile_positions.title: HR Process Analyst Knowledge Management

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities: 
- Supervision and coaching 7 expatriate transfer advisors (who coordinated approximately 450 international expatriate transfers to the Netherlands per annum
- Handling of complaints of expatriates about the transfer process
- Initiating and implementing continuous improvements for providing better service to the expatriates
- Migration of responsibilities of the team and myself to the HR service centre in Krakow, Poland.
profile_positions.title: Teamleader Expatriate Services Transfer team NL

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
- Supervision and coaching 2 expatriate remuneration specialists (who maintained remunerations packages of approximately 1300 expatriates in the Netherlands)
- Maintenance of remuneration packages of and providing remuneration advice to senior expatriate employees
- Coordination and correct implementation of the annual remuneration increase cycle.
profile_positions.title: Team Lead Expatriate Remuneration Services

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
- Coordination of Shell's participation at career fairs 
- Organisation of Shell ‘In-House’ days for students
- Focal point for study associations (10) of selected universities and subjects of study.
profile_positions.title: Recruitment Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
- Focal point for employees about the international mobility policies and international transfer process
- Assistance to HR skill pool managers 
- Coordination of the international transfer process.
profile_positions.title: Human Resources Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
- Administrative support to Head Engineer and the department.
profile_positions.title: Executive Secretary

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities
- Administrative support to Managing Director.
profile_positions.title: Executive Secretary

volunteer_experiences.description: Voluntary reader and coaching 3 volunteers, who take part of the VoorleesExpress The Hague. Purpose: Parents who actively encourage their children (2-8 years old) in their language development, by reading aloud a lot and encouraging them to read themselves, ensure that their children are more motivated to read, read more and be more literate. As a result, these children perform better at school. This positive influence remains present throughout the life course. Parents should start a positive reading education as early as possible.
